p: Highly abundant phenolic components can be divided into two groups: phenolic acids (caffeic, vanillic, ferulic, and rosmarinic acids) and flavonoids (luteolin, apigenin, and quercetin) [ 13, 44]. The most common monoterpenes include: α- and β-thujone, 1,8-cineole, and camphor. The most common diterpenes include: carnosic acid, carnosol, rosmadial, and manool. Triterpenes include oleanolic and ursolic acids [ 58, 60, 61, 62, 63]. In addition, sesquiterpene α-humulene and viridiflorol are also present in sage and extracts [ 23, 29, 60].
